statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Ivy Smith Jr. and Remond Brown each scored 17 points and the two combined to shoot 12 for 19 from the floor to lead Grambling State to a 102-56 win over NAIA-member Jarvis Christian on Monday.
article.headline: Smith Jr., Brown pace Grambling past Jarvis Christian 102-56
article.linkText: Smith Jr., Brown pace Grambling past Jarvis Christian 102-56
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Ivy Smith Jr. and Remond Brown each scored 17 points and the two combined to shoot 12 for 19 from the floor to lead Grambling State to a 102-56 win over NAIA-member Jarvis Christian on Monday. Jarvis Christian darted to a 5-0 lead on a layup by Walter Bell and a 3 from Sam Auguste before the Tigers took control on a 21-4 run. Brown's dunk with 12:13 left before the half made it 21-9. Grambling State (3-4) shot 36 for 73 (49.3 percent) to 18 for 49 (36.7) for the Bulldogs. Jarvis Christian was 14 for 31 (45.2) from the free throw line. The Tigers led 51-34 at the break. Ervin Mitchell added 14 points and Drake Wilks had 10 points and five rebounds for the Tigers. Dione Malone led the Bulldogs with 21 points and was the lone Jarvis Christian player in double figures.
